ingredients: 300g firm tofu (cubed), ½ cup yogurt, 1 tsp cumin powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, ½ tsp turmeric powder, ½ tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 2 tbsp oil, 1 onion (chopped), 2 tomatoes (pureed), 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp cumin seeds, ¼ cup fresh cream (optional), Salt to taste.
instructions: In a bowl, mix yogurt, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Add tofu cubes and marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the marinated tofu until golden brown. Set aside.
In the same pan, add cumin seeds, then onions, and sauté until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste, followed by tomato puree, and cook until the oil separates.
Add the fried tofu, and if needed, add some water for desired consistency. Simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Stir in fresh cream (optional) and cook for another 2 minutes.
Garnish with cilantro and serve hot with naan or rice.
